cons: Ramp is very self-guided after the initial bootcamp. Gotta be a self starter. And that's FINE, but it was definitely not the expectation that was set with me during interviews.

headline: Just started. View incomplete
pros: The hiring process is very transparent. My manager made it super easy to understand my comp plan and compare the befits of working at Salesforce
cons: Nothing yet. I expect that it's not like a traditional large company and hopefully the teams are allowed to have autonomy

headline: Culture and innovation
pros: Excellent culture and company is constantly evolving for the better through innovation.
cons: Getting too big which is complicating simple process.

headline: Salesforce takes care of their employees
pros:
Top Ten Reasons to work for Salesforce:

1) Highly competitive salaries, stock plans, 401k matching, high bonus potential.
2) Career advancement opportunities unlike anywhere else I've seen.
3) Challenging, fun work that really makes a difference for customers.
4) Always giving back to the community through philanthropy efforts.
5) Truly transformational technology that is always evolving with the times.
6) Flexible work arrangements, Work from home options, amazing parental leave program and sabbatical program.
7) Global Presence and many travel opportunities around the world.
8) Great company leadership.
9) Continues to grow at an incredible rate.
10) Smart, knowledgeable and fun coworkers, what more could you want?
cons: Everyone works hard, so if you want to coast, this is not the place for you.

headline: Best place to work
pros: Great work place, flexible work schedule and greater care for employee success
cons: Not that i know of so far

headline: Amazing Cultura
pros: Innovating and customer-centric culture. Takes good care of its workers.
cons: High Competitiveness between peers

headline: Great Work Life Balance
pros: Flexible Hours, Great Mentorship, Fun Work
cons: Very quickly growing, still learning how to be an enterprise business in some aspects

headline: Best Employer
pros: Amazing culture! Transparent and trustworthy leadership teams!
cons: Overwhelming platform capabilities - steep learning curve.

headline: Salesforce Recruiting
pros:
- Great growth
-Great face time with management 
- Earning potential
-Location
-Excellent culture 
- Opportunity to take Paid Volunteer time
cons: Growing a very rapid pace that may result in a loss of culture. The perks do not compare to other large tech companies in the area.

headline: Lots to learn, but comes at great personal cost
pros:
- Great teammates from variety of industries
- VTO and giving back to company keeps me motivated to be a force for change in our community
- Lots of great tools to train on
- Excited about the new products (IoT cloud, Lighting, etc)
cons:
- No work life balance - only way to handle daily work load is to sacrifice nights and weekend personal time.  So alternative is to fall behind to stay sane.
- No time to use the great tools for training
- Politics beyond anything ever experienced in an organization
- Self-branding is more important than team branding (superhero culture)
- Workload changes rapidly, in my org - change is slow (from a structure perspective)

headline: Enjoying my time at SFDC
pros: Coming from a very large and mature Tech company (also an industry leader), Salesforce was a breath of fresh air.  The culture within my group is one of ownership and exposure.  I have worked with more execs in my one here at Salesforce, than I had in my 5 years at my previous company.  Salesforce is also very engaging with volunteer opportunities, speakers and other hosted events that expose you to new ideas and perspectives both internally and externally.  Lastly, pay and benefits are very fair.
cons: Things can be more political than they initially seemed.  Opportunity to make an upward move are not clearly communicated. My group is not as flexible as most of the company/policies.

headline: Amazing place to learn & grow, but prepare to work hard for it
pros:
-Dynamic & innovative environment
-Top talent everywhere means you can learn from the best
-High growth rate creates ample opportunities for promotions
cons:
-High pressure due to fast pace, Sales reps have 12 quarter ends per year
-Need to be able to survive in an environment where learning is dynamic from peers and tribal knowledge vs. structured processes

headline: Inhuman
pros: Not many. I really did not like it here.
cons: Most inhuman atmosphere. They treat contractors like slaves, dumping double the amount of work. Fultime employees enjoy while contractors suffer.

headline: Awesome place to work!
pros: Amazing team and culture, plus lots of awesome benefits. I love working here.
cons: None that I can think of...

headline: #DreamJob
pros: Market leader with constant innovation.  Still lots of room to grow as a company.  Based in San Francisco!
cons: Sr. sales experience required.  Lots of products to learn.

headline: Perceptions Can Be Deceiving
pros: Growing, opportunities, innovative. Great bene's and pay. You'll learn.
cons: Has a lot more attitude, ego and greed than the outward facing benevolent front it publicly conveys. It's a hard driving, results oriented place that doesn't always put employees first. And it's gotten big, so be very careful about where you land and vet the people carefully; some are great, some are not.

headline: If Marc read his own book today, I'm pretty sure he would lose it.
pros: Great pay and bonus, lots of other perks as well, but there is much more to life than this. Puppyforce so you can bring your dog to work.
cons: Turning into IBM, way too many directors and above who have NO clue what they are doing. Was a great place to work. Now random imports are on power trips. Not feeling the Ohana at all.

headline: Great company to do the best work on your career
pros:
-Entrepreneurial working environment
-Countless projects you can start
-Ability to switch jobs within the company and acquire new skills
-Generally energetic and smart co-workers
-Career couching oppurtunities aplenty
-7 days of volunteering per year
-25 day of PTO after 5 years
cons:
-Unlimited/untracked PTO after you get promoted high enough; both a good and bad thing
-Communication is valued more than raw software output; again both a good and bad thing
-You advancement depends on the quality of your manager; there are great managers, but not so great as well; but they can't stop you from moving teams

headline: Salary
pros: Great benefits, wonderful technology, good people and plenty of opportunities
cons: Culture changing.  No work life balance

headline: Exhausting Place to Work
pros: Salesforce is a very innovative and exciting company to work for that genuinely puts the customer first. It is filled with incredibly smart and passionate employees who can be inspiring to work alongside. It also provides excellent benefits and compensation. And their philanthropic model is key to employee satisfaction.
cons: Salesforce is a very demanding place to work and 12 - 15 hour workdays are the norm across many departments. While the company talks about the importance of wellness and encourages employees to take care of themselves, they have yet to modify the actual workload and expectations that would allow employees to do that.

headline: RM
pros: Liked the area i worked in
cons: Disliked time at the company

headline: Systems Engineer
pros: Great place to work. Pleasant work environment. Had fairly good autonomy within my role until the acquisition. Its a good place to work if you just want a "job". Its a good job with good benefits.
cons: I came from a startup that was purchased. While the acquisition was exciting, my responsibilities and decision making capacity went elsewhere. Budgets were slashed, and employees were let go as the company was rolled up. My role became pigeon holed in much simpler and narrower responsibilities. I went from having one manager to have 5+ to convince for infrastructure projects. As a result, the politics were incredible. More time was spent on the politics of convincing others to make changes than innovation. We were a profitable startup, which was then managed by a less profitable business unit which caused a lot of investment politics.

headline: Good company
pros: Good atmosphere, fast paced, great customers, excellent products, a lot of opportunities, you can learn a lot and have fun while working
cons: The company is growing too fast, all is not under control, the culture can be distressing and sometimes losing focus on most important of work

headline: Great place to work
pros: Good pay, great benefits, they treat me well
cons: Many benefits are only available where Salesforce has an official office

headline: Salesforce Review
pros: Work-life balance, horizontal movement in roles, support system, fun work environment, welcoming
cons: lots of work, busy, commute, expensive to live in city, need more benefits

headline: Really is the no.1 best place to work in Ireland
pros: Open culture - lot of individual responsibility - play hard and lots of fun. 1:1:1 model is amazing
cons: Multiple sites which makes it harder to feel like a real community - though lots of events designed to bring teams together. Open culture and personal accountability & responsibility  is not for everyone. Have to be ready for a very fast pace

headline: about what you would expect from big corp
pros: There are some really great people working here. The company has some great benefits for families, volunteers, and service.
cons:
For the few people who are great, there are a tremendous amount of people who do "just enough" to not get fired. With a company that prides itself on "employee happiness" and not having lawsuits, it's not in their best interest to fire people. What you get left with is a dead sea effect (or people airing out their laundry).  Lastly, because it is mostly a sales company that sells software (not a software company) Many of the decisions are made in products favor without equal voice to engineering. Direct managers are punished for their employees leaving, even if it is the fault of the organization as a whole.  

Furthermore, since this company has so many acquisitions, you have the "Nest" Effect. Some organizations are terribly mismanaged and painful to those having to do all the work.

headline: Great place to learn and grow!
pros: Lots of growth and learning; incredible CEO and visionary; fun culture; great pay and earning potential
cons:
Political, which is a given with the growth; middle management do not receive training in managing people and are often on power trips (likely based on insecurity); territories are far from equal and the company will double up territories for those they want to promote to make them look good and justify the promotion; too many people eg overlays, excessive levels of management trying to justify why they are employed and create a lot of extra work for AE's;  takes away from selling and caring for the customers.  Too much 'AE Enablement'...AE's are now Customer Success, Technical Support, Operations, Sales Engineers as instead of hiring resources, everyone wants to train AE's to do their job...not a good use of high paid employees and takes away from productivity and revenue driving activities.

As AE's you are pretty much seen as a number and stat to 'stay in the box' without a lot of autonomy on how to spend your day.  Lots of burnout if you get sucked into the monthly 'life or death' culture to meet quota or be ashamed.

headline: The Foundation To Build A Great Career
pros: Great salary and benefits. Great opportunity to work with big name/global clients. Management is flexible with work/life balance. Definitely a place to build the foundation for a solid career within the business or elsewhere. Colleagues are helpful meaning support is available where required.
cons:
The job itself can be quite repetitive and not that challenging at times and there seems to be little exposure to other teams, meaning it might be more difficult to develop and move around within the company. Training is very weak - Much of the job involves on-the-job learning. 

Marketing Cloud exists because SF bought out Exact Target. There seems to be a divide between Marketing Cloud and the rest of the business business, meaning less integration with other areas of the business, but this slowly seems to be aligning.

Furthermore. the majority of the MC team are based in the US, which means working together often. Although, this isn't an issue, it feels as the UK team are in the US team's shadow.

headline: Sales Development Representative
pros: Great environment, always learning, work with incredible people
cons: really fast paced, sometimes hard to decide where to focus

headline: The Foundation To Build A Great Career
pros: Great salary and benefits. Great opportunity to work with big name/global clients. Management is flexible with work/life balance. Definitely a place to build the foundation for a solid career within the business or elsewhere. Colleagues are helpful meaning support is available where required.
cons:
The job itself can be quite repetitive and not that challenging at times and there seems to be little exposure to other teams, meaning it might be more difficult to develop and move around within the company. Training is very weak - Much of the job involves on-the-job learning. 

Marketing Cloud exists because SF bought out Exact Target. There seems to be a divide between Marketing Cloud and the rest of the business business, meaning less integration with other areas of the business, but this slowly seems to be aligning.

Furthermore. the majority of the MC team are based in the US, which means working together often. Although, this isn't an issue, it feels as the UK team are in the US team's shadow.

headline: Sales Development Representative
pros: Great environment, always learning, work with incredible people
cons: really fast paced, sometimes hard to decide where to focus

headline: Great Place to Work!
pros: Deep commitment to keeping employees healthy and happy. Impressive drive to be on the cutting edge.
cons: Technical debt is building up, and scaling has become difficult since the business is doing so well. Communication between departments is rough sometimes.

headline: Good Work life Balance
pros:
Good Work life balance
Good Work Culture
Giving Back
cons: Not found any as of now

headline: Amazing place to work, Philanthropy is huge!
pros: Amazing people, amazing leaders, amazing perks, philanthropy model is one of a kind and the ultimate reason I stay, great place to work - I like getting up every day and going to the office even though it is constantly busy and stressful, I look forward to time and experiences with my team
cons: Getting too corporate and losing the startup flavor  , entry level roles difficult to get out of in some departments , the wrong manager / employee dynamic kills the awesomeness of the company and great general vibe

headline: Innovation, Rewards, Growth, Agility thats what I have to say
pros:
Some History: I have been working here for last 4 years and seen various phase of company. Salesforce started in Hyderabad with acquisition of a startup. For 1st year there was a phase where startup people were trying to adopt to Salesforce culture and could not handle culture shift and left the company. It was a bad phase. However for last 2-3 years the new management brought of lot of change and the real Salesforce culture at Hyderabad center.  

Liked
* Awesome Talent: Got a chance to work day in day out with talent folks. Weather it is junior or senior all focussed for success of each other. 
* Quality work: A lot of quality work is done out of here. It is not a low lost center to throw degraded stuff.
* Openness: Literally, I can reachout to anyone. It is open desk and no cabin culture.
* Reward: Beat many companies in compensation. Best is rewards keeps on coming for folks who are ready to align themselves with company goals.
* Agile and Innovation: A culture of agility and innovation. 
* Work life balance: Except for a small window near releases, rest of the time I am having work life balance.
* Free food: I love it. No worries to getting tiffins or going out daily for food.
cons:
* As there is a talented pool of people around, you always have to come with best. Can be of concerns to some folks.
* Indoor games: No space for indoor games

headline: Great place to work
pros: One of the most innovative and open culture organization I ever work for.  Good pay and great benefits.  It would hard to keep up the expectation if I move to another organization.
cons:
None that I can think of.

One aspect that might consider con: 
- Salesforce is place for passionate employees. It doesn't to make you work overtime but you need to be passionate about what you do. It is not the place for those who like to do work are needed chore.

headline: Finance
pros: Great benefits, culture, and people
cons: None that I can think of

headline: Fast paced gratifying work with very smart people
pros:
Great culture, benefits, flexibility, and compensation. 
Working with some of the smartest people around
The company is constantly growing and it's an exciting time. The company is focused on giving back and letting employees do what they are interested in. Working with some of the most respected technology on the market.
cons: Not always easy to have a work life balance, although they encourage you to. Your internal social network is key to succeeding and moving up (this is a pro for some). If you can't cut it, they will cut you.

headline: Awesome product in an amazing company
pros: Amazing company, culture, and career.  I started in January 2016 and was inundated with the training and the tools to be successful.  People here truly care about the company, the products, and the success of every individual.  Pardot is the Salesforce Marketing Automation solution.  As a co-prime selling this product, I feel that the core team is extremely supportive and proactive in selling the solution.  And the rewards!!!  When you do well here - the SPIFF's are unreal.  ($10K towards shopping sprees, $10K towards trips abroad for two, etc).
cons: A lot of cold calling, but that is expected for any sales role.  The salary is slightly below industry standard.

headline: #dreamjob
pros: Great place to work, awesome technology, benefits are outstanding
cons: Onboarding is decent but you are on your own after that, sales process is lengthy and most are paid on an annual number but there is this intense monthly cadence number.

headline: Salesforce
pros: High profile, fast paced, high growth, great brand with great customers.  Technology is truly innovative and at a sweet spot in the market place.
cons: Very few experienced managers and very little regard for the individual or work/life balance.  Internal culture often more about show than substance.

headline: Recruiter (Sales)
pros: Salesforce is literally the best company I have worked for in my career.  I work alongside smart people and am challenged every day in my role.  We are consistently growing at Salesforce, at about 30% year-over-year and there's a ton of opportunity to continue to grow and develop my career here.  The company has a huge heart and giving back is baked into the company DNA.  We have the 1:1:1 philanthropy model and our employees receive 7 paid volunteer days annually which we are encouraged to use.  Mindfulness and wellness are always promoted within the organization.  The kitchen here is fully stocked with yummy, healthy snacks, beverages and great coffee.  The collaboration is phenomenal here and I have found that if you ask for help or advice people are always very warm and willing to give their assistance.  The company has won every award under the sun for both their business solutions and employee engagement and being an employee here you can really understand why.  #DreamJob is for real.
cons: The company certainly isn't perfect, it's a rapid growth company and we move very fast.  What's been different about Salesforce however is they listen to issues and will discuss openly and be very transparent around challenges.

headline: RVP
pros: Fast paced, employee focused from CEO on down
cons: Fast paced, can be hard to keep up

headline: Dreamjob!
pros: Own responsibity to schedule your workday. Work when you are best. At place where you want. But do be productive and deliver results
cons: Create your own motivation. You have to be sharp every day to deliver best of your quality. There's a lot to explore.  Do so!

headline: Sales is out of sync with Corp Culture
pros: Maniacally driven to succeed. Customer Success is the driving message and builds great momentum.
cons: Sales Management is driven to grow at all costs. Culture of the firm is very positive and philanthropic messages are very positive however the maniacal need to grow 50% y/y puts customer success in second position over deal completion. The growth messages are coupled with sales culture that is not long term relationship (Trusted Advisor) messaging that the overall company convey's to the market.

headline: Awesome
pros: The structure is set up for you to succeed providing you are willing to work hard, a give and take fair situation.
cons: Not any cons - happy there. Good environment. Great people and managemt.  I think myself lucky to be working there. Keep up the good work

headline: Business Development Rep
pros:
Great sales and prospecting training
Fun culture to work in and really smart, talented people 
Great benefits 
Legit products
cons: Hard to take vacation or you will be really behind and stressed out

headline: Such high expectations but it's been a bit of a let down
pros:
* The company is truly driven by it's top leadership to product quality products for their customers. 
* Rapid growth and the name makes it easy to hire top talent 
* compensation is the best in town
cons:
* political nightmare 
* minorities need not apply. input from white men is the only one that's actually listened to in engineering. 
* little desire to collaborate at the management level. they are all just fighting rather than focusing on customer needs 
* although the executives speak about quality, middle management only wanted to get features out fast so they could complete their v2mom. One VP of product said "I don't care about releasing just completing the feature in dev so that we can show progress." 
* constant direction change with little to no reasoning or explanation. One day do this. Stop sprint. Do that!

headline: Pretty much the best company on the planet to work for.
pros: The culture, collaboration and emphasis on customer success are legendary, and for good reason.  Lots of opportunity to work with smart, talented people and to have an impact on the businesses you work with (customers) and yes, the world (through the company's support of philanthropy.)
cons: Biggest challenge I've found is maintaining some semblance of work/life balance. I'd say that's mostly on me, because the company makes impressive efforts to support employee wellness, but it's also a very common issue among employees.

headline: Senior Solutions Consultant
pros: I am a new hire to Salesforce, and the onboarding process has been incredibly well organized, engaging and FUN!  They have step by step instructions of everything you need to do to get set up and if you get stuck EVERYONE is willing to step in and help.  I have been blown away in my first week and am excited to see what else there is to come.
cons: I have not seen any to date, but I am also still in the honeymoon phase.

headline: Sr. Director
pros: The company REALLY cares about it's employees. It's not the usual lip service. The values are reinforced from the tippy top, and managers throughout the company are given continually updated training and tools with which to ensure the employees experience their #dreamjob. It's really uncanny
cons: Does Salesforce have issues? Yes. But does any company have no issues? No. So any cons pointed out will be run of the mill issues. Nothing untoward nor earth-shattering. If one looks at the big picture, there really are no cons.

headline: Decent place to work
pros: Lots of fringe benefits, ones you may not even find yourself needing or wanting (e.g. free coffee bar, free beers, paid massages)
cons: Due to the growth, employee working space and privacy are both commodities that are somewhat lacking. How can you concentrate on your job when there is noise and distraction so plentiful? Over the summer, some workers are literally shoulder to shoulder.

headline: Work hard and the rewards are there for you
pros: Incredibly vibrant company. Very flat leadership allows opportunities to accelerate your career. Always lots of amazing career options. Best large company to work for in Ireland - fact!
cons: Work life balance can be a challenge, but it all depends on how one likes to function. Not a problem for me.

headline: Senior Front End Engineer
pros: Great benefits, easy to work with everyone. Lots of room for growth. Low pressure environment
cons: Too large of a company to feel important. Lack of transparency between the different level of management

headline: A wonderful place to work!
pros: Supportive work environment with a truly awesome culture! I feel valued and taken care of at Salesforce. It's my dream job!
cons: Company is growing fast and as a result there's a growing bureaucracy that's makes it difficult to get things done quickly and efficiently.

headline: Sr. Strategic Account Representative
pros: Awesome technology and top notch people
cons: Too many sales reps and very small territories / selling opportunities.  Lots of sales turnover.

headline: SMB Account Executive
pros: Work hard/play hard attitude, culture is very collaborative, coworkers are always willing to share resources/best practices, 1:1:1 model encourages volunteer initiatives
cons: Extremely competitive, quota's are high, pretty cut throat

headline: Don't work for FinSrv - Oracle bullies in mgmt!
pros:
- Peers are smart and super talented
- Salesforce is a great company to work for.  MarcB is a CEO with a heart and vision.  Him taking on global economic issues and putting the corporate stand behind movements like LGBT is remarkable and very rare in CEOs.  He is the modern CEO
- Products are best in the market.  CRM, ExactTarget are definitely the best in the market so you are not selling something that people don't already love or want.
cons:
- FinSrv vertical is struggling.  Big bang accounts are rare and easy lay up accounts are given to Oracle friends, boys click.  
- FinSrv Accounts pie is cut too many ways
- Pay out is every 2+ years if that
- Worst is the new Oracle culture. Mgmt is all about badging and silly stickers and certifications you need to get to be able to tell the customer story when they should be helping with relationships & focusing on the problems at hand
- global AEs are just in title, they don't actually get paid on global revenue - so watch out for that when you review your comp.
- Comp % is low from market but can be better if you are Oracle friends 
- Mgmt bullies into inflating pipeline and force commit deals every quarter

headline: Understaffed, NO work/life balance
pros: Will look good on your resume, Paid volunteer work,
cons:
Benefits are not at the same level as other tech companies. (Only 2 week vacation to start, no catered lunch, 401k only match $0.5 for 1$ you contribute...)

From here my comments apply to the  Marketing Cloud:
No work/life balance, seriously..This is a huge one. 
In paper the (limited) time off/volunteer benefits sound good but the reality is very different. In order to take any time off (at least in the In the Marketing Cloud group) you need to find someone to cover while you are gone. Since everybody is spread so thin it is going to be almost impossible to find a colleague that can cover. Can't find someone to cover? Sorry that's too bad, time off denied.
1 month advance notice to take 2 or more days off!, 2 weeks advance notice to take a 1 (yes a single) day off! Are you kidding me! Forget about being able to have any spontaneity/freedom to plan a long weekend to decompress when needed.. Off course people are going to burn off.
You may pick some valuable knowledge/skills working here but the price is too high for people with a life outside work.

headline: Highly compensated jobs with limited room for the growth
pros: Great benefits with top of the line perks
cons: Politics and very limited room for the growth; lack of transparency

headline: Exceeds Expectations!
pros: I thought a company like Salesforce was too good to be true! One that cares for its employees and empowers them to innovate; a company that provides out-of-this-world benefits and an environment of trust and support!  I feel energized every day to want to do a great job for the company and our customers.  If you are looking for more than just a job, Salesforce is the place to be!
cons: There are opportunities for improvement, which is not different from other companies.  The difference with Salesforce compared to my former employer is that there is opportunity to make a big impact at Salesforce, which opens the door for doing business better and reduces the red tape.

headline: Strategic AE
pros: Good branded company. good milestone in a carreer.
cons: small territories. High targets. The "godfather" style in management.

headline: I enjoy working here!
pros: great culture, great people, fast-paced, fun
cons: growing large very quickly, no meals provided

headline: Fantastic Place to Work!!!
pros:
Seriously a phenomenal culture and place to work all around. Employees are being spoiled by Salesforce and in turn are given way more employee perks (housing/travel stipend, regular events, ect), and are in an environment where employees have amazing opportunities for growth in their careers and abilities.

The engineering culture is open and employees are often encouraged to teach others their expertise. The team is impressive and talented, and for the most part, the only people that have ever left the company have only done so to go start their own companies.
cons: The team is growing fast, and who knows what will happen to the culture with such a massive growth. The founders are dedicated to keeping the culture, but somethings are simply out of ones control.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: I have only just started. But from the start you can tell that the company culture is strong and it is a great and challenging place to work.
cons: There is a strong learning curb for those of you who do not come from technical backgrounds

headline: member of technical staff
pros: culture is laid back and accepting
cons: i do not have anything to say

headline: Good idea of culture but bad bad politics
pros: The idea of good culture can be found in smaller teams or with great leaders..
cons:
politics are heavy and you'll find yourself in the sour end of the stick real quick if you don't play along. 
Ideas aren't welcome if you don't have seniority 
Red tape to get approvals for anything is strong 
Bad internal communication

headline: Recruiter
pros: I'm provided constant opportunity to grow professionally and personally. Surrounded by top talent who work collaboratively to achieve common objectives.
cons: In an ever changing and dynamic environment, it's key that you make an effort for a good work/like balance.

headline: Very good work culture
pros: Salesforce has very good work culture. Innovation is driven by passion at salesforce.com
cons: These days having more management than development.

headline: Recruiter
pros: I'm provided constant opportunity to grow professionally and personally. Surrounded by top talent who work collaboratively to achieve common objectives.
cons: In an ever changing and dynamic environment, it's key that you make an effort for a good work/like balance.

headline: Very good work culture
pros: Salesforce has very good work culture. Innovation is driven by passion at salesforce.com
cons: These days having more management than development.

headline: Software Engineer
pros:
- Good work/life balance
- Good Benefit
- Fixed release cycles
cons:
- Some politics
- A little slow since the company size is large
- Changes in products

headline: Great Benefits
pros: Great staff benefits, great environment and smart colleagues!
cons: Perhaps better flexibility in managing customers.

headline: Account Executive 5
pros: great culture; great customer awareness; great marketing
cons: scale to large customers can be spotty given project lifecycles

headline: good company
pros: good work culture, perks and products they develop
cons: not any specific as i found

headline: Great culture, great products, great place to work!
pros: For me, as a pre-sales person it's really important to feel like you're supported by a wider team and have the backup to address tricky problems, questions and requirements from customers. At Salesforce we have that in spades. Not only are my immediate team always willing to pitch in and help, but so is the wider pre-sales organisation and people from other teams. There is a really strong sense of family in the organisation that stems from the CEO downwards and permeates the culture. The products are rock solid too, and continually evolve at a terrific pace which keeps a techy like me constantly challenged and interested (always something new to learn)
cons: The pace of the company can be exhausting at times, but that's what keeps it interesting.

headline: Good place to work
pros: Excellent benefits and tools to work with
cons: Second fiddle to license sales

headline: Salesforce.com
pros:
Salesforce takes care of you. Great Work/Life balance and plenty of ways to get involved either at work or volunteering within the community.
Equal pay for equal work is a core belief of the organization. 
Lot's of great benefits and driven people to work with.
cons:
Fast-paced, for some this may be too much.
Management has numbers to hit and will make sure that you are performing in a way that you will hit them. Sometimes competing priorities can drive out productivity.

headline: Senior Member of Technical Staff
pros: Company is growing tremendously. A lot of innovation is happening on both product and infrastructure side. People are generally very helpful and if you are willing to work hard, you can create opportunities for yourself. Great perks and social conscience. Great volunteering opportunities.
cons: Over the last year or so, there is an influx of people from a certain software behemoth. While it is understood that any leadership change will bring with it a new paradigm, I do believe that sometimes people are given more importance than people that have built the systems and been hugely successful, just because they come from a certain company. As a consequence, sometimes, either attrition of domain experts is high or there are growing signs of disapproval with how the management thinks.

headline: HR
pros: Great company that cares about its customers.
cons: Growing fast and that means never ending pressure for deliver

headline: 10 years of service and going strong
pros:
I have been at Salesforce in the UK for 10 years. I am a little biased but, for me, the highlights for me include:
- Leadership and Vision - our technology, business and philanthropy models continue to transform the industry. Being in the sweet spot of customer, mobile and social - are fortunate enough to be CEO relevant across all sectors. 
- Growth - being at a company that grows at our pace is immensely exciting. It creates a wealth of long term opportunity. 
- Culture and values. the company cares. It cares about social issues and equality, the community and indeed employees. Salesforce works hard to foster a spirit of family that I appreciate.  There is a super spirit in the UK where I am based. 
- Customer success - the product set is phenomenal. Our customers broadly love Salesforce which makes for a great customer facing career.
cons: The ambition of the company - for some people - can be a little relentless. Those that don't embrace big ambitions and change integrate less well into the company.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Great corporate culture and products.
cons: Turnover in the Texas Market

headline: RVP Sales
pros:
Great technology.
Great Customers.
Strong Benefits.
Long term vision is compelling.
cons: It is easy to burnout.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Culture is fantastic, and product sells it self...sales persons dream
cons: None really, if you can get it, its great!

headline: SMTS
pros:
- Best company I ever worked for
- Great benefits
- Great work/life balance
cons:
- Rank inflation
- Work culture varies team to team

headline: Very early hire
pros: Great on boarding competitive salary
cons: No cons to working here at this time

headline: Senior Technical Program Manager
pros: So far, the company appears to walk the walk around topics of culture and diversity. 7 days of time off to volunteer! Exceptional snacks. Top notch planned/managed on boarding plan that involves periodic automated emails paced to when you need the information. The company lives and dies using its own product as the backbone of collaboration ... and it works very well! Appears to be very supportive of both windows and mac environments and has a top notch IT environment. Has a strong internal culture of supporting people that consider changing jobs.
cons: Current shake up in relocating the Seattle office.

headline: Strong focus on a healthy culture
pros:
Strong focus on a healthy culture
Support for health and wellness programs
Family feel  - people take care of each other
A sense of being part of something exciting
Encouraged (expected!) to give back to the community
cons:
Very high pressure and workload
Always on

headline: #Dreamjob
pros: The company culture is nothing I have ever seen.  Everyone is so helpful and genuinely cares about your success and future.  I was so fortunate to land a job here and I plan on staying a long time!
cons: The only thing (and this is very nitpicky) is that the office has grown so fast, but management has done an amazing job of keeping everyone connected.

headline: salesforce intern
pros: vibrant culture, opporutnity to work around many exceptional peers, fast-paced work environment creates diverse projects, reputation in the industry, company growth
cons: office politics, changes in the workplace may be excessive

headline: Excellent company
pros:
Smart co workers
Awesome management
Lots to learn even as a lead engineer
Lots of opportunities to attend training
Pay is competitive
cons:
Be more competitive with perks, e.g. free meals or more shuttles
Non-HQ offices receive less love
Some promotions seem to be a popularity contest

headline: Best Company To Work For
pros: Amazing company for experience, long-term career potential, and great culture
cons: have to be ready to work in a large corporation with many different players

headline: Good company culture,
pros: Great company benefits:  VTO (volunteer time off 48+ hours annually), Good medical, dental, vision.  Flexible work schedule (can work from home when you need to).  Convenient to get to work via BART or public transportation (down town SF).  Overall company culture and benefits are good!
cons: Career development/advancement (at least with IT) is poorly done.  Training, career development are not done very well (lots of surveys on what do you want for career advancement, etc but nothing is ever really done).  IT knows this is an area where employees are not happy.  Movement/mobility to other positions (both within IT and to other areas within Salesforce) is difficult and doesn't seem to be encouraged.  Also company seems to be more bureaucratic and difficult to get things done that it used to, but maybe that's the price of becoming a much larger company.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Fast growing company that invests in its products while focusing on customer success. Fast pace keeps you focused on driving towards company initiatives.
cons: The pace isn't for everyone. The shiny lights turn to spotlights once you're carrying quota. There is a revolving door for those that can't hit their numbers or cannot adapt to the environment. Put your best foot forward!

headline: Overall review
pros:
- great place to work
- fast pace 
- 1-1-1 is a great way to give back to the community
cons:
- growth is not defined well
- mgt team is so swamped that they dont take time for team/team events

headline: Amazing place to work
pros:
Salesforce is an excellent place to work. Having worked for many other Irish companies, the Salesforce workplace is in a league of its own. I love working for Salesforce and look forward to going to work every day.

Pros:

- Culture: Salesforce has a unique culture that enables everyone to be successful in their role. It encourages everyone to help everybody. The Salesforce foundation gives you a week per year to do volunteering work also.
- Career development: If you work hard and do the right things you will progress rapidly. The upside for your career is huge. Options to travel, work in other Salesforce offices are all there.
- Benefits: Amazing benefits including pension, gym membership, stock, 5k education grant, bike to work scheme and much more.
- People: You are surrounded by brilliant people. Its a work hard, play hard environment. You will make a lot of friends at Salesforce.
- Management: Salesforce Dublin has an excellent management team. The management are professional and undergo extensive training. As a result, they are very adept at getting the most out of their teams.
cons: No major cons. Salesforce does a huge amount for its employees. Expect to work hard at Salesforce. The travel can be tough at times but you get used to it.

headline: Great company yto work for
pros:
Care for their employees
Team spirit
cons: Travel can be a bit much

headline: so far so good
pros: it's what you make of it here.
cons: nothing you wouldn't find anywhere else

headline: Sales
pros: Overall a great company to work for!! Would highly recommend working for Salesforce.
cons: Sometimes it is a little hard to not bring to take vacation but once you do its so work it!

headline: Happy employee
pros: A great company to work for
cons: The pay could have been better

headline: Employer of Choice
pros: Great onboarding with a amazing focus on ensuring you're up to speed rapidly and efficiently. Truly amazing and helpful culture from top to bottom.
cons: Due to rapid growth your team regularly changes.

headline: Just Awful
pros: Flexible work practices.  World class benefits.  Informal working environment.  Get to work with some amazing peers.
cons: It's with a heavy heart and reluctance that I share my review.  Salesforce is an amazing company, however, within the department I work there is an overriding culture of insidious bullying, throwing people under the bus, lack of support, openness, coaching and development.  Promotions are based not on your ability but for political reasons and whether your face fits, especially if you are able to 'toe the party line' and do not step out of line with the department head.  This environment has been created and sustained over the last few years based on fear; if you are good at your job and have a point of view, no matter how professionally you express it you know your time is limited.  The final result?  A department which is wouldn't look out of place in North Korea, you would state black is white just to keep your job.  It really is that bad.  The worst of it is that this is known about at a very senior level and for some time and yet nothing is done to remove the perpetrator from the organisation.  For fear of retribution I dare not share any further details, suffice to say that it's non-sales, and it's a department which should be the gold standard for promoting the Aloha culture.  I'll leave it at that.

headline: Technical Program Manager
pros: Good company to work for, smart people who are held accountable for their work at all times
cons: Not very good work/life balance. Depending on the job that you do, sometimes you will need to stay late and work weekends.

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Feels like the company actually cares about your well being as an employee. The leadership empowers employees to take action and encourages them to do so. Excellent technical challenges. Great atmosphere and great people. Very good compensation and benefits.
cons: There aren't many. The build is a bit archaic, but it is being improved. It can also be difficult working at a site which is outside of HQ: you have to be prepared to be treated like a remote employee. It's easy enough to overcome this, but it isn't for everyone.

headline: Engineer
pros: Everything is good! Management is very supportive in your career and personal life.
cons: No applicable for me since I have no cons to say. This is a very good company to work for.

headline: Awesome Company
pros: You will be treated amazing.  Everyone is always positive and willing to help.  Management is appreciative of your work and is glad you are there.
cons: The work can be slow and dull at times.  Occasionally there are fun scaling problems, but that's not the norm.

headline: great culture - growing too fast
pros: Values and Culture - Teamwork and mutual Respect
cons: Compensation to short sighted (make every month)

headline: AE- ECS
pros: Great management, Amazing opportunity to grow, great coaching
cons: Could pay more, more education on product

headline: Area Vice President
pros: Incredible CEO with compassion, vision, and true to his values
cons: Company is getting big and losing its intimacy of a small and nimble startup.  Now at the 4th largest software company, it has the challenges of a large company

headline: Greatest place i have ever worked at
pros: Really smart people, great culture, lots to learn, awesome perks, moves fast
cons: The speed at which the company is growing also presents its own challenges.

headline: Visionary Company, but Politics and Egos Rule the Roost
pros:
- Excellent core product
- Bright engineers
- Visionary company that tries to foster innovation
- Make the right connections and you have it made
- Learned more there than the rest of my career combined
cons:
- Politics, politics, politics
- Smart people but out-of-control egos
- Generally a company-wide smug attitude 
- Big disadvantage if you don't wok at HQ
- It takes a real fight to get credit for anything positive, while you also have to fight to not have blame for failures pushed onto you
- Poor management (both middle management and executives)
- Horrible internal communication

headline: Good company to work for
pros: Perks, Work life balance, Recognition and Challenges.
cons: Constant push for delivery, poor learning opportunities in some teams.

headline: Great for learning
pros:
Great career experience
Lots of emphasis on progression and education
cons:
Toxic culture in some teams
Politics - a lot of being seen to be doing things rather than actually getting work done
Things are moving in country so career progression stagnates if you are not willing to relocate
Wages vary wildly depending on how much you negotiate 
No transparency
Lots of egos
EMEA seemed to be an afterthought after the US

headline: Salesforce
pros: Great company culture as Salesforce.
cons: Salaries are not competitive in all locations.

headline: SFDC Careers
pros: Overall great company to work for. Nice office spaces, and generally speaking staff are well looked after. Quick to adopt new technologies when appropriate, so always have access to the best tools to get the job done.
cons: Working outside the San Francisco head office can be a challenge. Career progression in certain departments outside of head quarters is non existent, and relocation is not for everybody.

headline: Amazing company to work for
pros:
Best large company to work for in Ireland 2016
Good package
Free snacks
Flexible working from home
Good culture - work life balance, 7 days of volunteering per year, social events
This company is growing super fast!
cons: You need to be a hard worker to cope with the fast pace!

headline: #Dreamjob!
pros: Culture / Growth / Innovation / Products / Leadership
cons: Change is constant but thats only negative if you let it be

headline: great place to work
pros: work/life balance, great support, flexible hours
cons: none I can think of now

headline: A very exciting company for which to work.
pros:
Salary, benefits, perks all top notch.
Every opportunity for growth that I could imagine is given.
Our leadership really cares; it's not just a tagline at Salesforce, and I mean 'cares' in the broadest sense of the word. Marc's leadership on organizing against the various discriminatory legislation in the US is a great external example. Know that this extends to our internal structure as well and is the bedrock of our corporate culture. I'm gushing, I know, but it's truly how I feel.
cons: Know that there is a high pace to the work at Salesforce. We work in an area of the industry with tremendous growth and continued growth potential. Some people may not fit well in such an environment.

headline: Great company everywhere but Chicago
pros: Benefits are best in class and the company truly gives back through charitable activities. There is a product offering for every line of business.
cons: Ultra micromanaged, terrible office morale, revolving door sales team.  Leadership is out of touch and fills the day with ridiculous reporting and busy work.  Consistent missing payments in your paycheck. You'll have to chase down every deal. Zero work / life balance.

headline: Hyderabad Office sucks
pros: there are many but no use , so no comments
cons: I wonder how the people in middle level management are non responsive and how they can take liberty and convert a product based company into a BPO .

headline: Senior sales Rep
pros: Great culture, great pay, very team and results oriented and very robust training
cons: Can become a game of politics when it comes to promotions and managing your brand

headline: Great company, Great people, Great product!
pros: Salesforce hires the best and brightest in terms of employee talent and that just makes the overall experience wonderful.
cons: Salaries are not quite as competitive as other firms out there but the ESPP makes up for that given the stock has been doing well.

headline: Mixed Emotions
pros: Great set of Cloud Solutions, Do it Attitude
cons: Old body Network internaly, Lot of pressure often not useful

headline: Better than the hype
pros:
I was a customer for years before working at Salesforce, so I knew I loved the product/technology and loved what I could see from the outside.

On the inside, it's really cool.  I've had a chance to work with a lot of customers, build cool apps with them, and work with some brilliant people.  Not HQ--this is a non-hub remote location, doing Sales Engineering.

If you do great work and do some gentle self-promotion (posting your work and helping others) then you get recognition and rewards for that.

You really can't ask for more than that.
cons:
It's rather frantic.  If you like knowing what you'll be doing a few weeks from now, that doesn't happen here.

Sales people don't learn quickly enough now that Salesforce has so much product to offer.  Sometimes we don't get the right people in that role.

There's a lot of emphasis on activity logging, which is the least fun part of the week.

headline: Onboarding
pros:
Lots of information, well orchestrated, fast paced.
Engaged, enthusiastic and helpful staff through the process
cons:
Lots of hiring can add to delays in onboarding certification requirements
Technology choices are somewhat restricted for laptops/mobile device choices.

headline: Great place to work
pros: The company does a very good job of treating it's employees well.  The benefits and flexibility is second to none.
cons: Because of the speed of company growth people are being promoted into Manager and Director roles that quite honestly aren't ready to manage people.

headline: Salesforce
pros: Good place to work on balance
cons: None with the company itsslf

headline: Great Product
pros: Great Product to use. I had to relocate
cons: I have none actually, but thanks

headline: Salesforce
pros: Good place to work on balance
cons: None with the company itsslf

headline: Great Product
pros: Great Product to use. I had to relocate
cons: I have none actually, but thanks

headline: Working here is great. Management is very supportive and coworkers are friendly.
pros: Friendly coworkers. Healthy work environment. Very enjoyable place to work. Management is supportive of employees and always tries to help employees grow their career.
cons: Can be a long commute from East Bay as it is in San Francisco. Sometimes Bart gets delayed, which lead to long commute hours.

headline: Great Company
pros: Great company to work for, culture is great and you get to literally run your own business.
cons: No career progression, culture doesn't feed down from HQ and managers take on their own culture. They don't grow the internal staff and would rather hire externally than promote from within to reach the growth targets.

headline: Great company with an amazing sales process
pros: Great sales environment. Excellent learning experience.
cons: Success on their sales team is highly dependent on the territory you're assigned. A lot of politics as well.

headline: Moves as quickly as a startup, but with resources + ethics
pros:
- Curious, energetic, competitive team gets more done in a week than I ever thought possible. 
 - Management encourages expanding your role, trying new things, building new skills.
 - Company leaders are transparent and communicative. 
 - Volunteer Time Off (VTO) -- 56 paid hours given to each employee per year for volunteering.
cons:
- Standard growing pains of any company scaling quickly; understanding how new roles fit into the bigger picture can be tough. 
 - Work-life integrity, while encouraged, is not always visible among leaders.

headline: Proceed with caution
pros: Great company culture and exciting company to work for.
cons: Beware of your territory assignment if you are in sales. High turnover and growth dictate that territories may not be sustainable.

headline: ios developer
pros: good team and learn a lot
cons: nothing and I feel everything is perfect

headline: Account Executive
pros: Excellent professional and personal development opportunities.  I came from a relatively old school company, and Salesforce was the ultimate sales bootcamp. I was extremely marketable leaving SFDC, and look back on my two years fondly.
cons: There are too many AEs and not enough territory.  I increased revenue in my territory by 400%, and didn't hit quota. Only 20% of AE's in my vertical hit their quota, and all of them had been there for 5+ years.

headline: Incredible culture.
pros: The company values their customers and employees. The solutions are innovative and the company culture is addictive. You're encouraged to grow and be better every day.
cons: Intense at times. If you don't know how to manage your time then you could get stressed out. If you're not good working as a team then you won't survive.

headline: Hard work, but many befits
pros: 6 days a year volunteering, not much politics, everyone is treated equally
cons: Every day is intense, work long hours, not always clear promotion path in some departments

headline: Sr Delivery Manager
pros: Great place and high energy and innovative products
cons: too much going on at the same time

headline: Big Company that Cares
pros: While Salesforce is a large company, there is a real focus on its people and the community at large. Opportunities to learn and grow abound and the career mobility around the company is high. Salesforce also offers its employees paid volunteer time off (VTO) every year which allows us to give back to our communities.
cons: It is a very large company so it is possible to sometimes get "lost" in navigating the company structure.

headline: Salesforce pre-sales
pros: Very positive company, focus on work life balance, good benefits, great people that like to work at salesforce
cons: Some conflict between "Old" salesforce culture (people who have been here a long time) and "newer" people from established enterprise software companies such as Oracle

headline: Best work experience so far
pros:
Great, fun and talented people

Work culture is awesome 

Philanthropy model is quite surprising
cons: Nothing much to complain about so far

headline: Excellent
pros:
Very supportive and great progression with the company 
Great use of technology and very modern workplace with flexible and working
cons:
No cons that I can currently think of as I have had a great experience with Salesforce 
Moving into SF tower will be great

headline: Pre-sales Solution Engineer
pros: Very collaborative selling environment with many opportunities for advancement.  The Salesforce product works and that makes technology sales much easier than other companies.  There is the opportunity to talk to multiple different types of businesses providing many opportunities to learn about new industries.
cons: The company can feel clique-like at times

headline: great company to work for
pros: CEO with great vision and first-class employees
cons: getting too big with some bureaucracy

headline: Great place to work!
pros:
- Huge emphasis on the importance of self growth by means of education reimbursement.
- Extremely committed to charitable giving and support the community we live in.
- Talented people are hired and importance is given to team work.
- Health & Wellness benefits are provided to stay healthy and focused.
- Offers free meals!
cons: Some processes need to be built, but that's an opportunity that I see.

headline: Interesting work and they really care about you as a person
pros: Management really looks to make you happy and if you have any issues with the work you're doing or the people you're with, management will try and make things work out.
cons: Not much, really. You might find it surprising how much stress they put on Security, which might slow down some projects

headline: strategic Account Manager
pros: Great culture, great technology that works. Very rewarding place with smart people and where you effort means something.
cons: Very fast paced culture and demanding, if that is not for you will be hard to enjoy everything salesforce has to offer.

headline: Just awesome
pros: Really amazing job keeping up fast paced atmosphere while showering us with perks like high comp and training. At my previous job, I was one of the first employees at a startup, so was worried that Salesforce would be boring. Nothing like that.
cons: Very siloed, frustrating at times

headline: Amazing company, but it has real challenges
pros:
The perks are there, but the culture is what matters. There's a sense of purpose about why Salesforce exists and how every employee can contribute to that purpose. 

* People are smart - if you are open, you will learn a lot
* The work is challenging - this not a place for slackers
* Plenty of non-human resources - you'll more tools to do your job than at most companies. 
* Can be a very collaborative work environment
cons:
* Salesforce is developing a hubris, similar to what I saw at Microsoft and other large companies. It smacks of "but we're salesforce, we're hot s***" - We're not listening as well as we should. There's a distinction between confidence and arrogance that is being missed.

* Sometimes senior employees, those with 6 or 7 or more years with salesforce often exhibit the most narrow thinking about how to approach problems. There's a tendency to rely on what's worked before and apply the standard old salesforce playbook to new problems and challenges. This reinforces narrow thinking and devalues the experience of newcomers.

*The headcount growth has negatively impacted the social and emotional intelligence of the organization. New hires sometime struggle to integrate into the culture and develop the healthy and authentic  relationships that facilitate higher performance. They flounder and leave too soon.

* There's a growing cognitive dissonance between the 'practice mindfulness' and 'work/life balance' that is preached and the pressure to do the work and volunteer more (56 hours a year). It generates cynicism. 

* The cost of living in the SF Bay Area is ridiculous

headline: An Excellent Destination
pros: Trusted to get things done, Resources to achieve goals, Snacks are rad, Great company values, #Ohana, encouraged to give back, Comp plans are great, starting a mindfulness kick.
cons: Starting to have huge company feel, at times disconnect from hubs to SF, Crazy (but fun) growth expectations

headline: Product Manager
pros:
It is a very family like environment. People are genuinely nice .
I love our 1-1-1 policy, and the emphasis on mindfulness .
We even have dedicated zen space in our new buildings. 
I feel appreciated and I am grateful to be a part of this Ohana. You are given all the opportunities and feedback to be your best.
cons: If thinking on your feet, and juggling multiple balls, and embracing change is not your thing, you might not really enjoy working here.

headline: Innovative Company
pros: Free snacks, great benefits, flexible PTO, ability to work from home, quarterly bonuses, laid back culture, plenty of opportunity to grow within organization.
cons: Sometimes when you work in a such a big company it's hard to get noticed for the value you provide and when it's as big as Salesforce it's hard to get assigned to work on truly strategic projects.

headline: Overall Good Company
pros: Awesome perks, great people, good training, successful company.
cons: Difficult to navigate as a newcomer. Took me 3 weeks to get set up with a phone and laptop. For a tech giant that preaches innovation, they still have areas to catch up with.

headline: Great technology and culture more progress needed for diversity
pros:
* Market leader in enterprise cloud computing with accelerating momentum
* You'll learn a lot of best practices in software development
* Great company culture with top-down alignment through V2MOM process
* Awesome philanthropical vision with 1-1-1 model and so many volunteering opportunities not to mention the $5000 annual foundation match
* Company has made great strides in gender equality and providing opportunities for women in leadership and taken a strong stance against LGBT discrimination
cons:
* Company is getting large and with a large influx of new hires there are the growing pains it comes with that
* Leadership opportunities and promotions for minority (Hispanic, Black, Asian) males seems lacking

headline: Sales Strategy and Operations
pros:
- Great place to learn about sales/go-to-market strategy by watching others - Salesforce emphasizes sales and growth across the company which makes this position (as one tightly aligned with the sales team) one with significant view across functions
- Strong company brand name
- Great company-wide culture of giving through Salesforce Foundation and CEO's lead
- Good average quality of coworkers on team
cons:
- Compensation is low relative to peer companies
- Days can be long (11-12 hrs minimum) and, after ~1 year, provide diminishing marginal return from the same role (result of 11-12+ hours of the same thing every day)
- Team is hierarchical, having lost any "startup" feel it had as a result of significant growth. Result is a more political environments
- Career trajectory within company is undefined and getting narrower as team's growth slows and more management levels are introduced. Promotion periods have also been extended, with fewer opportunities for "moving up" as a result
- Rapidly diminishing exposure to senior management - more of a "performance reporting and presentation creation" role for the managers on the team

headline: Senior Manager
pros: Free snacks in the office.
cons:
No advancement for women.
High stress.
Bad management.

headline: Sales Strategy and Operations
pros:
- Great place to learn about sales/go-to-market strategy by watching others - Salesforce emphasizes sales and growth across the company which makes this position (as one tightly aligned with the sales team) one with significant view across functions

headline: Senior Manager
pros: Free snacks in the office.
