headline: Technology
pros: Fun company to work for. Fun culture. Many perks
cons: Growing too fast. Might jeopardize the culture of the company and might move in the direction of very coorparety

headline: Analyst
pros: Regular Tech Perks, ability to work from home as need be, a lot of room for advancement once in the right group
cons: Management does not know how to manage, lots of technical strong person but unorganized skills. Lack of interesting projects.

headline: Great place
pros: Progressive company. Customer focused. Great culture.
cons: I can't think of any. Great place

headline: I love it here
pros:
- Amazing Benefits
- I truly enjoy working with everyone I've been working with for the past four years. 
- 1:1:1 model and getting volunteer time off
- Managers always receptive to suggestions on different ways of doing things 
- Many opportunities to grow
cons: - Too much emphasis on utilization a

headline: VP
pros: Everything you hear about the company is true. The culture, the technology, and the people are the second to none.  Everyday I come to work I am inspired and supported in ways that I never was at previous software companies.  Our dedication to Giving Back (1-1-1 model) and wellness truly are unique.
cons: The company is growing quickly.  We're still learning how to balance scale with best practices. I rather like that we have autonomy to figure things out on our own as leaders.

headline: An Ideal Company
pros: Salesforce is a big company with very good employee healthcare benefits.
cons: Strict implementation of company policies. Sometimes you have to bend a little to accommodate employee requests.

headline: Database administrator
pros:
Good work life balance and compensation. Excellent benefits
Team bonding and outing
Internal geographical movement
cons:
- Anyone can only select if you have any referral candidates from internal employees within the team. 

Example - there are 4 interviewers in DB team Singapore. First round will be done by the lead which is real and logical interview and the second round will be taken by any of the senior member in the team.

You will able to shortlist the second round only if you know anyone within that team else they will simply reject you in second round. For example, if person A refer someone and if he rejected in first round then whoever attend the interview on second round either one in the team will reject you

This is happening for past more than a year

headline: Director
pros: Amazing company to work for - fast paced, innovative, very focused on customer success & happy employees
cons: Still got a lot of growing to do so is somewhat tactical compared to other enterprise software companies. If you join - come planning on helping to create solutions not follow someone else's plan

headline: Fast growing, exciting, with growing pains
pros: Awesome culture, great salary, exciting work, smart people, great location, great benefits, not afraid to learn from failure, great learning opportunities
cons: slow to change, slow releases, becoming more political

headline: Product Marketing Manager
pros: Amazing career opportunities, great culture and people. Feel very well compensated to live a great life in San Francisco which is an expensive city. Highly recommend.
cons: Lots of pressure to excel in this company, a great deal of competition and pressure. I thrive in that environment but it is not for everyone.

headline: Salesforce.com Review
pros: Great senior level leadership (CEO). One of the best companies culturally that I've worked for. Good pay, excellent benefits, fun place to work, strong focus on the employee.
cons: There seems to be a good deal of turnover in the Sales roles and like most of the Enterprise Software companies that I've worked for it seems that they move accounts around a lot between salespeople, which generally isn't good for the clients.

headline: cool company to work at
pros:
smart people to work with
growth with bright future
fast-pacing environment
cons: everything is changing, may not be a bad thing, depend on your preference

headline: Region Vice President
pros: Great company.  Great products.  Happy customers.  Amazing culture.  I was proud to be a Salesforce employee, and would absolutely work their again.
cons: I can be difficult to become a true member of the team if you are remote, and not in a hub.

headline: Enterprise Account Executive
pros: Great Pay, Great Core Values
cons: Bate and switch with territories

headline: Senior Account Manager
pros: Greatest technology in the world of it's type. Strong remuneration. World class sales techniques. High employee standards overall
cons: Politics were rife in the sales department and rules were broken

headline: Lead Member Of Technical Staff
pros:
Smart people, interesting projects.
Flexible work environment
Good culture.

Team bonding is really good, many people are easy to work with and communicate with.
cons:
Conservative in many ways, need to avoid breaking customers.
Monolithic codebase, need more focus on productivity.

Hard to work across teams sometimes.
Hard to get things done often.

headline: MTS
pros: very good work life balance
cons: a lot of re-org recently

headline: Great Company
pros: The culture is fantastic. The training is also really structured and sets you up for success. There is an emphasis on growth and improvement so always opportunities to learn more.
cons: It has become a very large and successful company so if you are looking for a startup or small company experience this will not be a fit.

headline: Great Company
pros: The culture is fantastic. The training is also really structured and sets you up for success. There is an emphasis on growth and improvement so always opportunities to learn more.
cons: It has become a very large and successful company so if you are looking for a startup or small company experience this will not be a fit.

headline: Dream Job indeed
pros:
Innovative and dynamic company
Good People
Company cares about employees
cons: Growing so fast some of the culture might be lost.

headline: working at salesforce
pros: Culture is great, work opportunities are everywhere and the opportunity to make impact are limited by your capabilities. Company is focused, driving the entire business segment forward, and the leadership has great vision and are maniacally focused on execution.
cons: The code base has some tech debt, and the infrastructure could improve on its ability to deliver capacity. The product is great, but the time it takes to get stuff done is longer than optimal.

headline: One of the best for all the right reasons
pros:
- culture is strong, positive and very employee centric
- pay is very good and competitive to the market
- our company give you SEVEN (7) days VTO, volunteering time off and encourages us to use them
- tons of visibility, and you have access to lots of information
cons:
- your career path may be limited if you do not live in one of our hubs 
- although this may not be a negative for everyone, the company moves and extremely fast pace, and if you do not keep up with it you made quickly find yourself disconnected from the momentum of the company

headline: Great place to work
pros: My team was undoubtedly the best part about my Salesforce experience - the office environment is great, excellent perks as well. I really loved the idea of VTO (volunteer time off) and giving back to the SF community to repair some of tech's damage.
cons: Prepare to work HARD - and often feel overworked. It's a lot to handle, at times, and very fast-paced. It's also easy to feel like just a number here given that there are thousands of employees in SF.

headline: Best tech company
pros: Salesforce is one of the best tech companies to work for. Great benefits, competitive pay, free snacks, and so on. The product and service offering are best in class. People here are incredibly smart and talented.
cons: Teams are very siloed. Head's down work environment. A lot of people do not participate in work events because they're too busy. If you're in services department, you won't have the best work/life balance

headline: Great benefits, big company beaurocracy
pros: Lots of resources (money for interesting marketing spend), generally really smart, good people to work with, excellent benefits.
cons: Very large company that wants to work in fast-paced start-up mode, but because of sheer size, everything takes longer than you'd hope and approvals can be a nightmare.

headline: Evolving
pros: CEO - passionate technology visionary and passionate philanthropist and promoter of social justice. He is the reason this company continues to have the success and brand strength(as a technology company and employer). Despite size and age, the company continues to be an innovative leader with continued growth potential.
cons: Hiring and promotion decisions are at times perplexing. Senior leadership seems disconnected from the masses. The organization is getting big - HR needs to be more involved and influence more.

headline: I can't believe I landed such a great job
pros: The culture here is fantastic, I'm actually excited to go to work every morning. My coworkers never cease to impress me, and that's not limited to my engineering cohorts, technical and non-technical people across the company are phenomenal at their jobs. The benefits are excellent, ranging from your fairly typical health insurance and stock options to free catered meals, train passes, and a sizeable monthly housing stipend for living within 3 miles of the main office in Palo Alto. On top of that, the company listens to it's employees and acquires things people want. For example, recent acquisitions included a foosball table and a new cold brew kegerator.
cons: Honestly the only downside I've been able to come up with is that they don't allow dogs. The relationship back to SFDC core isn't perfect (more stringent security and trust requirements), but as a multi-billion dollar company with multi-million dollar contracts that rely on the integrity of secure customer data I can understand that.

headline: Infrastructure Division is an appalling place to work
pros: Overall,  the company is great.   Salary and bonus are great,  and the offices are great,  interesting places to spend the day.  Charity time off is superb.
cons: The infrastructure Division is run by a group of cronies from Microsoft, and they have ruined the culture completely.  In contrast to the product groups, infra has a climate of fear and outright bullying.  People are leaving in droves, and nothing is getting done.  I left after being bullied to the point where my health was affected.  What should have been a dream job was a year long nightmare.

headline: Excellent culture, great growth
pros: Excellent culture and great growth. Great recognition, but you need to figure out your own career path.
cons: Better stock compensation. Clear career path recommended.

headline: Admin Assistant
pros: Very helpful and the training was awesome.
cons: there where no cons working for the company.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Smart people and big challenging problems to solve in engineering.  People are allowed to be innovative and take chances.  Focus on giving back (1:1:1) is pervasive throughout the company.
cons: Infrastructure engineering is very top heavy.  It's become an org of overpriced ex Microsoft executives that have not delivered anything of value to the company and the group.  There is complete lack of innovation in management style or technology. They have brought with them the management style of the 90's, which didn't really work to well for MSFT.  The feeling in the group is contempt for Salesforce and the people committed to Salesforce.  People work in fear, which is not the culture it was before they joined.  It's sad to see the disregard that they have towards building an org on the values of Salesforce.  Bad  behavior and horrible treatment of individuals has been overlooked time and time again by HR and management.

headline: Legal Counsel
pros:
- Products are best in class
- Beautiful Office Spaces Worldwide
- Employee Stock Purchase Plan
cons:
- Pay is no longer competitive with peers
- Long Hours with little recognition
- Limited ability to move up in the company

headline: The best company I have worked for (so far).
pros: Volunteerism, flexible hours, work from home, excellent management, great benefits, competitive salary, innovative company, great client base, prioritize client needs and employee needs, amazing coworkers
cons: Changes with acquisitions, remote employees sometimes feel left behind - but do get caught up. Company culture differs between cities.

headline: Senior Manager
pros: The people, the training and the innovative product.
cons: We're getting too big and are less and less connected with our employees. We struggle at times with deciding between doing what's right for the business and doing what's right for our people.  It's inevitable with a mature business like salesforce.

headline: AE
pros: Great company.  Market leader.
cons: You need to get good accounts to be successful

headline: Overall great company doing great things
pros: Great benefits and perks, flexible schedules, challenging work
cons: Opportunities for advancement working outside of HQ are limited

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Allows for day-to-day flexibility & is personable, continual growth, very little downtime. I've thoroughly enjoyed working at Salesforce, and have had four different positions (which have all provided unique, practical experiences) that I could not be more grateful to have had the opportunity to undertake.
cons: Large company bureaucracy (red tape), difficult to work your way up in the company (in large part due to large size & red tape). Work can be monotonous at times (somewhat turns you into a one-trick pony), but, all-in-all, is typically fulfilling on a day-to-day basis.

headline: Best Company to work for!!!
pros: There's a reason why this company continues to make Forbes Top 50 Companies to work for. Very driven workplace & a wonderful atmosphere
cons: No cons to list. Everything is great, grade A++

headline: Sr. Account Executive
pros:
- Amazing, fast-paced environment with tons of opportunity for growth. Management is open to new ideas and deal strategies. Talented, fun group of colleagues. 
- Fruit and various snacks and beverages for free
- Great corp travel policy
- Recently launched a "Wellness Day" with a guest speaker that seems to be quarterly
cons: - Mixed messages from the sales management team when it comes to focusing on customer's success and prioritizing aggressive growth creates a pressure-sale environment which can/does damage our relationship and credibility

headline: Sr. Account Executive
pros: The people are young, vibrant, and very smart.  The company believes strongly in walking the walk and talking the talk; the 1/1/1 model isn't just marketing.  The company will outfit you with the hardware, tools, and skills to be successful.  Ability to move within the company in different departments is definitely there.  The work hard/play hard philosophy is alive and well.
cons: Growth and change can be challenging to manage.  Sometimes when new products are rolled out, they're not fully baked.  As in many places, there can be a cliquey/fratty feel to some of the sales teams but nothing that can't be managed.  I had to be diligent about tracking my sales to ensure I got paid appropriately; it was a pain in the butt but I learned this the hard way.

headline: Enterprise account exec
pros: Headquarters great culture and promotion opportunity
cons: If you are considering the enterprise business unit or any sales don't accept the job until you know your accounts/assignment.  In enterprise sales they are cutting your accounts in half each year and your quota goes up

headline: Member of Solution Engineering.
pros: Great company culture, products, and family.   Amazing conversations with customers on how to transform their business.   Culture of teamwork, change the world attitude.  Lots to do but everyone pulls together to make it happen.   Dreamforce is a game changer.   We run the company from our products.    Gives pace and transparency.   Love it here.   Best job in my career.
cons: No real cons.   There is so much opportunity in the market that it's difficult to get to it all.   Quality people that have to ramp quickly when they come on board.

headline: Amazing Family to be a part of
pros: I have never worked at a company where everyone truly bought into the team concept until coming to Salesforce.  I truly feel my managers have my back and the team around me is focused on the same goals.  The technology is amazing and the company is laser focused on our customers' success!
cons: Things change fast!  The company is growing very quickly hiring nearly 6000 people this past year.    Not really a bad thing, but definitely something to be prepared to adapt quickly to personnel and technology changes.

headline: Inspirational and forward-thinking
pros: Culture, benefits, work, volunteerism, caring, inclusive, fast, great leadership by example, everyone is extremely bright, helpful and there is an open culture. Easy access to executives and mentors.
cons: There are really low cons, can't think of any at this time. Perhaps this is based on the different teams or locations.

headline: My Dreamjob
pros:
+work/life balance
+amazing company events that employees can attend (dreamforce etc)
+1-1-1 model is real; we attend at least quarterly team volunteering events and there are constantly opportunities to give back
+lots of opportunities to move around within accounting and other groups within the company (I've been in 3 different roles in my three years here)
+great leadership
+many opportunities to enhance processes and learn
+cafe with great coffee/baristas
cons:
-Large accounting org and sometimes you're not fully aware of what other teams are doing
-no free lunch

headline: Dreamjob
pros:
-Great work/life balance

-Well qualified management with relevant experience/education in their fields who will support staff and give them ample opportunity to prove themselves.

-Collaborative culture. Positive team environment in which it feels like everybody is pulling for each other and on the same team.

-Incredibly intelligent workforce: Salesforce is able to use its strong brandname to hire only the top talent and as a result has an environment where you are constantly challenged and learning, which continuously develops your own skill set. (Less than 1% of applicants receive employment offers)
cons: Teams within accounting are very compartmentalized and offer little visibility into what the others are doing.

headline: Salesforce Review
pros:
- Great culture
- People are amazing
- Everyone is willing to help
cons:
- Too much to learn
- Not a lot of guidance in certain areas
- Micro-managed in certain roles

headline: Truly unique company
pros:
1. CEO and company is constantly trying to enhance customer experience, products, culture and processes
2. Business runs extremely well on its own technology 
3. Truly innovative technology and integrated foundation efforts (donation matching, paid volunteer time)
4. Amazing level of transparency
5. Still feels like a small company
cons: Could do better with career planning, especially for remote employees.

headline: Truly unique company
pros:
1. CEO and company is constantly trying to enhance customer experience, products, culture and processes
2. Business runs extremely well on its own technology 
3. Truly innovative technology and integrated foundation efforts (donation matching, paid volunteer time)
4. Amazing level of transparency
5. Still feels like a small company
cons: Could do better with career planning, especially for remote employees.

headline: Better be in SF
pros: Great culture. Great people. Great comp
cons: Headquarters centric. Unless you're in San Francisco you don't get the same culture and its an uphill battle to get in with the top projects.

headline: Account Executive (ESB)
pros: Fast career development, continuous training.
cons: Difficult work/life balanace at times

headline: Sr. Manager
pros:
This company provides me the independence to contribute all of my talents and abilities.  I love that they encourage us to give back to our communities and they are taking a leadership on important issues around equal pay and not allowing discrimination of their workers through regional legislation.

The first year.. I didn't get why we had to transform the company - I thought it was the coolest company but now I get it.  Transformation keeps the company healthy and growing!
cons: With the growth - customer relationships can suffer when we re-align territories and new people are working with an account.

headline: sales, customer service, collections
pros: helping other better their lives
cons: dealing with rude people sometimes

headline: Recruiting
pros:
Dynamic, ever changing company that is focused on customer success and growth.
Culture of transparency and collaboration.
1/1/1 model
Paid Parental Leave
Great career opportunities regardless of location
cons: It can be hard to have a work/life balance.

headline: Good company for Democrats
pros: Great salary and benefits. Free snacks and drinks in the break rooms. Many opportunities to give back to the community during work hours and donation matching grants.
cons: This company's leaders is doing everything it can to ostracize conservative-minded employees and men. If you don't agree with "the company's" political agenda, you had best keep it to yourself or your career will take a hit.

headline: True 'Ohana' spirit
pros: Very clear management vision. Innovative. Fast-paced. Lots of positive energy. There's a culture of empowerment that enables you to move your career forward.
cons: Growing very fast that sometimes it's hard to navigate around the different groups and departments.

headline: Pre Sales Solution Engineer
pros: Culture is great and the products are terrific.  Customers trust Salesforce and are very receptive to working together with the company.
cons: Growing pains as a result of fast growth but given the rate of growth, the organization recognizes this

headline: Could not be happier
pros: SF has exceeded my best expectations, even after having worked with Salesforce team members for awhile as a customer. Now that I am onboard, I cannot believe how energizing the culture is.  Marc has vision!  Giving each employee 7 paid days to volunteer for their favorite non-profit is putting their money where their mouth is when it comes to 'giving back.' This changes the work place perspective completely!
cons: I didn't go to work for Salesforce sooner.

headline: Solution Engineer
pros: Amazing culture. Fast-pace change. Innovative. Great technology. Full of opportunities. Giving back at the core of what we do.
cons: None I can think of

headline: First Time I've ever loved my job
pros:
***FOR SALESFORCE.ORG***
-Start-up culture with big company benefits
-7 days of paid volunteer time off
-enthralled in a work environment that is committed to giving back to better the communities we live/work in
-love my co-workers and colleagues: I work with smart, passionate, ambitious, hard working and fun people
-working from home is an option a few days a month
-travel with my executive 
-PuppyForce!
-free snacks and coffee drinks
-beautiful new buildings to work in
cons:
***FOR SALESFORCE.ORG***
-we work hard but I'd say we maintain a solid work/life balance
-HQ is located in San Francisco, so unless you have rent control it's quite an expensive city to live in!
-High expectations of performance from Sr Management (however I find this as an interesting challenge and motivating)

headline: No growth if you are remote.
pros:
Fast Paced
Growing
Hiring aggressively the best talent
cons:
SF centric
New Managers coming in who have no idea of how to leverage skill sets
Too many re-orgs especially in CSG

headline: Technical Support
pros: Most innovative, great people and culture
cons: Very fast paced and exciting so not for all

headline: Fantastic Company - Fantastic Culture
pros: Ideas are not only encouraged, you are allowed to execute against those ideas with the agility of a small company.
cons: Remote employee engagement could get better, but the independence it provides is unparalleled.

headline: Salesforce changing the midwest
pros: Great culture, rapid growth in a time of slowdown in the economy.
cons: Corporate culture has not filtered down to all BU's.

headline: It's pretty great company, actually.
pros: The work is exciting. The people are generally friendly and good at their jobs. There are lots of nice perks. The company supports charities and employee volunteerism.
cons: No Cheetos in the kitchen.

headline: Director Technical Program Management
pros:
Interesting work, open transparent culture, very friendly helpful people for the most part!  Love the philanthropic programs the company has, which is encouraged from CEO down:  they provide 6 paid days off to volunteer at a charity; if you use all 6 days, they give $1000 to a charity of your choice; they also match any donations to charities up to $5000 per year.

The leaders in my business unit have a really good vision, but could do better to communicate it downward all the way to the ICs.
cons:
So much work to do! So much infrastructure to fix - to automate.  The leaders know that things need to be fixed and have provided a vision, but they need to do a better job of communicating it and ensure we are all marching to the same drum beat.

From a Technical program perspective, they need to hire more!  They are in middle of a transition, and from an Infrastructure Engineering perspective they are currently at a ratio of about 25-30 engineers per TPM. It needs to be more like 10 engineers per TPM.

headline: Mobile Architect
pros: Really a great company to work for.
cons: Not many cons for the company. Maybe work life balance issues.

headline: Sales Development Representative
pros: The development and training in this role is the best in the world. It is nice to work with some of the best talent that is out there.
cons: It takes two years before you are in a closing role. Although development is everything in Salesforce and this training will pay off.

headline: Mobile Architect
pros: Really a great company to work for.
cons: Not many cons for the company. Maybe work life balance issues.

headline: Sales Development Representative
pros: The development and training in this role is the best in the world. It is nice to work with some of the best talent that is out there.
cons: It takes two years before you are in a closing role. Although development is everything in Salesforce and this training will pay off.

headline: IT
pros: Overall, great department. lots of work, great staff, to much food and snacks
cons: lots of food is wasted, management style is not good. Too much micro-management, it seems like they do not trust their staff. No career path defined.

headline: Dreamjob Central
pros:
- My manager is strongly invested in my career growth, and ensuring I am pursuing all opportunities to move up
- My team is dedicated to ensuring worker morale stays high and positive, and actively works to reduce burnout
- Top notch benefits
cons:
- Salary is not the most competitive when compared against other companies of this size
- Can sometimes run into corporate red tape when trying to get things approved

headline: Sourcing Analyst
pros: Great work/life balance, benefits and career opportunities
cons: Start-up company growing into adolescence is fostering a slightly more siloed environment

headline: Work hard, play hard....
pros: Great culture, love coming to work
cons: Pressure is on, everything is visible all the time

headline: A Truly Great Place to Work
pros: Autonomy, Opportunity, Amazing Resources, Perks, Great Exposure, Tons of Learning, Trust, Respect, Vision
cons: Not as much 1:1 development as I had expected

headline: Great tech, horrible management
pros: Great work environment in terms of office, technology and ergonomics.
cons: Horrible team building and platform for dealing with employee concerns. Everything was too automated even down to the human resources. Management is not always on site, often times the team manager can be in a different country which is frustrating.

headline: Great Company Culture
pros: Company Culture, Management, Career Advancement Opportunities, Work-Life Balance
cons: Cannot think of any cons

headline: A great place to work
pros:
Lots of energy and passion throughout the company.
Genuine respect for diversity.
cons: Relentless pace sometimes compromises work/life balance.

headline: Incredible company. Exceeds all expectations
pros:
- Incredible leadership
- Incredible training and development
- Everyone takes great pride in their work, the company culture, the brand, and the constant innovation
- All values are not lip service. Everyone in the company lives and breathes these values every day.
- Everyone expects excellence
cons: It is a very competitive environment. The company has done a really good job cultivating a culture of ownership, accountability, trust, and potential for growth. Not a con, but the vast majority of employees are type A personalities that want to win and advance through the ranks. People are very collaborative and supportive because that behavior is rewarded at Salesforce, and these types of personalities making up Salesforce is largely why the company has been so successful. That said, as is the case of any ultra high performing environment, everyone wants to be at the top.

headline: employer review
pros: techically well versed employees and a challenging environment.
cons: none that I can think of at this moment.

headline: A Great Experience
pros: Everyone at Pardot really does genuinely care about your success and wants to see you excel. I honestly can't imagine a better work environment.
cons: I'd be hard pressed to come up with any major cons. I do wish that I had more of an opportunity to advance within the company before h

headline: Great
pros: Benefits, culture, smart people...work hard and get promoted
cons: Great company but becoming too big for it's own good.  Some of middle management is not very well qualified but are there by chance - timing.  Can have a very Bro culture.

headline: Still continues to be a great company
pros: I work in sales and have found that while the company continues to explode in growth management continues to strive for a culture that was here since Day 1 - which is tough, if not impossible to do.  I've been here for 8+ years and enjoy coming to work, learn from management, and see a career path for long term success. Great benefits, community of employees, and the CEO continues to inspire.
cons: Growing into a huge company creates a lot more layers and a lot more red tape. I don't have many examples of where that becomes an issue, but sometimes it's harder and slower to get things done. Overall, the company and platform continue to address this.

headline: Enjoying the run
pros: Significant presence in Chicago; amazing solutions
cons: Continuing to grow solutions & capabilities

headline: One of the great companies to be in
pros: Volunteer, work-life balance, DF concerts, bonuses, ESPP
cons: growth becomes stagnant after couple years

headline: Best company I've ever worked for, with one huge flaw
pros:
It's great to work for the 800 pound gorilla. Does YOUR company have Stevie Wonder as the opening act of your CEO's keynote speech? Hmm?

Everything about the company is world class. The benefits, the opportunities, the projects, the technology, and even the compensation for most roles. Some of the sales reps get a raw deal with territories, but if you're one of the lucky ones, you can really do well.

Salesforce continues to lead the pack in innovative social policies. They were one of the first major companies to initiate a comprehensive review of female compensation, which is very much appreciated. Some women at the company received substantial raises, which one one hand is great, but on the other hand raises some uncomfortable questions.
cons:
This is a tough one, because I love this company in so many ways. I'm not a bitter ex-employee; on the contrary, I'm extremely happy here and I want to have a long career with Salesforce.  That's what breaks my heart about how little commitment to diversity the company has.

To illustrate the point, I am black, and I cannot reveal my gender and office location, because doing so would reveal my identity. That's how few black employees we have at the company. 

Now, it's easy to fall back on the usual tech industry explanation of there being a "pipeline issue" that ties to minority education in STEM. There's absolutely truth to that, as you can't recruit what's not there. 

But here's the thing: when you fill your ranks with the same type of people in order to maintain some sort of "company culture", you create an environment in which the employees don't have enough exposure to people not like them to think of them as co-workers. The proof? If even your fictional website, PowerPoint and product demo characters are all white, there's a deeper problem than a simple "pipeline issue". It means non-white people are not part of your worldview.  

The implications of that are dire.

headline: Performance engineer
pros: Good product, smart people, a lot of snacks
cons: Too many meetings, especially daily standup meetings

headline: Success Manager
pros: Technology, culture, benefits, Work life balance
cons: Too many directors, no body to do the actual work!

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Great leadership team, proven track record of success, relevant and improving perks for employees, builds a productive and successful team culture.
cons: Sometimes, there can be some politics and with its rapidly growing pace, there can be challenges with that growth. Change is a constant, which means you have to constantly adapt.

headline: Senior Account Executive
pros: Salesforce offers lots of little perks such as food, drinks, ping pong, etc. They also have a good benefits package with health and dental.
cons: They title people as Field Account Executive however they do not truly operate this way. The culture is 100% IN OFFICE (nothing wrong with this but just be honest when bringing new folks on board). Very little work life balance as my team was unofficially "required" in office for 55+ hours every single week. It's a great place to work if you want to simply live just for SFDC, and feel like you're a hamster running in a wheel 24/7/365.

headline: Good Company
pros: Great Culture and amazing benefits. They do a good job of providing a solid work life balance.
cons: Big Company - lot of hoops to jump through, career path is hard to navigate

headline: Strategic Account Executive
pros: Best thing about Salesforce was the great culture amongst employees. They had a Collaborative and team approach to many things.
cons: Very few accounts to work on, recruiter basically lied to me told me I could make tons of $$$. I left a high paying job for the promise of a higher paying one. Found out it's all a lie and only the ones that have been there forever are making any money. People are jumping like rats on a ship and their turnover is more than 50%. Management has no clue. Neither does Marc Benioff.

headline: Great first job!
pros: Nice place to work, good amenities for employees, fun, fast paced environment, always growing.
cons: Things move very quickly and change often, hard to settle into anything since everything is always changing.

headline: Great Company, Bad Direct Management
pros: Strong C Level Leadership. Great Pay, Perks and Benefits.  A great company doing great things, very strong vision for the product and company.
cons: IT Management has devolved into a completely political organization. Success is defined by who you know, not by the work you do or your results. Promotion to management is unplanned and turnover is high.

headline: Salesforce
pros: Awesome culture , Remote team , Innovation
cons: - nothing at this point

headline: Disapointing
pros: Competitive salary, good bonus options and benefits
cons: Lack of good people managers

headline: #Dreamjob
pros: Salesforce offers a diverse environment, full of well knowledge people. Great atmosphere, open floor plans so it does not feel like a cubicle farm. Company Perks, great benefits, decent work-life-balance. Ability to work remote or from home is a plus. Fast paced culture. This is a great company to acquire new skills and be able to grow personally and professionally.
cons:
- Staffing shortage.
- No overtime eligibility.
- At times you can feel like you are underpaid for the amount of work you put in or your skill level.

headline: Love the company, people and overall work environment
pros: Every person I have come in contact with has been helpful and friendly, seriously!
cons: Hmmmm sometimes the body wash is placed in the conditioner container in the office locker room showers.  Seriously, that is the only con I could come up with about this place.

headline: #Dreamjob
pros: Salesforce offers a diverse environment, full of well knowledge people. Great atmosphere, open floor plans so it does not feel like a cubicle farm. Company Perks, great benefits, decent work-life-balance. Ability to work remote or from home is a plus. Fast paced culture. This is a great company to acquire new skills and be able to grow personally and professionally.
cons:
- Staffing shortage.
- No overtime eligibility.
- At times you can feel like you are underpaid for the amount of work you put in or your skill level.

headline: Love the company, people and overall work environment
pros: Every person I have come in contact with has been helpful and friendly, seriously!
cons: Hmmmm sometimes the body wash is placed in the conditioner container in the office locker room showers.  Seriously, that is the only con I could come up with about this place.

headline: Fast Paced
pros: Great culture with great people.  Fast paced environment with great on-boarding to get you up and running.  Awesome events such as Dreamforce.  You can tell the CEO is invested in this company's success.
cons: Management seemed to be spread to thin sometimes.  They were in meetings for interviews, etc due to high growth of the company.  Sometimes seemed to be more reactionary than proactive with some reps.

headline: Business Value Services at Salesforce
pros: All of the best aspects of Silicon Valley corporate culture (free snacks, generous benefits, deeply philanthropic, committed to gender equality, true meritocracy, stock based comp). On top of that, the company has been innovating rapidly and has a really strong and rich company culture. Lots of internal mobility available to top performers.
cons: Career path in my role is loosely-defined. Gets to be a bit too much of a 'salesy' locker-room type culture on occasion.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Very strong brand recognition in market.  Great experience selling an enterprise platform solution.  Strong internal culture of giving back (1:1:1 Model).  Superb CEO ledership.  Fun perks.
cons: On the lower end of wages for top companies in the bay area.  Middle management seems to be chosen by expediency (timing, willingness) rather than talent in some cases.  Company's falling down point is in middle management and lack of rep training.  Many new acquisitions and products that reps aren't trained to sell.

headline: Good company for those that can move fast & aggressive
pros:
-Excellent benefits and pay
-Great technology in a competitive market, market leader across multiple technology areas
-Innovative and forward focused
-Aggressively pursue company and business unit goals
cons:
-The whole "Ohana" thing is more of a marketing ploy; Didn't really see it much in action internal to company
-As other have said, you can "fail fast" if you aren't ready to run fast
-Very little formal on-boarding specific to your job; highly dependent upon willingness of manager and others to help you = is a potential point of failure for a newbie
-No work/life balance - in some teams, travel is +75%
-A lot of young people that are able to work 70 hours+/ week and travel; while dependent upon the team, a lot of positions are not conducive to those with family
-More

headline: 30 Day Status Report
pros: Company is still in hyper-growth mode. Still building FIELD sales model, so I see alot of opportunity. Company invests weeks of time and money in on-boarding new employees, including a week-long trip to HQ in San Francisco to get a first-hand look at the culture. Selling a platform now, so sales is still SFA focused, but so much more to offer to customers today.
cons: You better be organized, driven and accountable. People fail fast here.

headline: Amazing place to contribute to an awesome vision
pros:
- Benefits are top notch
- Work with tremendous talent
- Organization puts communication and teamwork first
- Fast paced, intense, but rewarding
- Great pay
cons:
- So much to learn!  It can be overwhelming.
- Would love to spend more time at the home office.

headline: Great place to work
pros: If you do your job and do it well, you can advance
cons: If you dont do your job well you wont last long

headline: Account manager Mid-Market
pros: Good salary and latest devices like iPad etc
cons: most horrible company I have ever worked for, be prepared to sign your life away. Ok, they give you everything, new IPad, iPhone etc but that because they want you to be for the company 24/7. As example: I was on holidays at Christmas and my boss actually rang me on 24th of DEcember for my forecast and that we were not making number and if I could call some prospects if they would sign a deal for a high discount.!!! Talk about crazy....

headline: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
pros: Great coworkers, great leaders, great benefits, tons of free food, tons of free swag. Super innovative.
cons: It's a very large company.

headline: good for a stable life
pros:
flexible time
good benefits
good location
global offices
cons: tech stack limited to salesforce

headline: Great place to be - wonderful place to start out your tech career
pros:
The people are really the best part about working here. I've worked with employees all over the world and the common thread is that they are good, thankful, hardworking and decent people.
Marc is an amazing person to follow. Dreamforce and All-Hands meetings that we all get to attend or stream live tend to hype everyone up and renew our spirits.
cons: The perks are great but the pay for an entry level person is not great. It all depends on the department you join. If you are in an org that doesn't make money (like HR or Customer Support) you simply won't be making the kind of money that Sales and Marketing is making.

headline: Sr. Sales Executive
pros: Good career opportunities. There's a lot of focus on employee development and training. The company is always striving and taking action to do better for customers and employee. Products are second to none.
cons: Strategic accounts buying cycles can are feast or famine.

headline: Great company
pros: Great company with superb executive vision, chances for upward mobility, aggressive compensation packages and industry-leading suite of solutions to sell to customers.
cons: None at this time, but work-life balance is something to consider, as this is a high-pressure job with high expectations. As long as that is considered beforehand, there should not be any surprises.

headline: Great company with great vision
pros: Salesforce offers incredible benefits and perks. They are focused on overall employee well being. Everyone is very positive.
cons: The monthly quotas can be taxing and seem to apply even if you are on a Quarterly quota. Company provides no guidance-assistance around channel conflict. Employees are promoted too quickly and lack maturity.

headline: Great flexibility, good pay and benefits
pros:
Flexible work hours and location
Ability to choose projects to work on
Good support and feedback from management 
Great culture 
Engineering process and tools are moving in the right direction
cons:
Product management group is dysfunctional 
Limited accountability to managers and engineers 
Some people/groups spend more time arguing why something is too hard rather than just doing it

headline: Excellent place to work
pros: They have a great culture
cons: Always expected to work harder

headline: #Dreamjob is a Reality
pros:
- Mobility within the company
- Excellent leadership from the CEO down
- Growth and training opportunities
- Challenging
- Pay-for-performance is an actuality here
- Family (or as we say, "Ohana") culture
- Opportunity to work with Thought Leaders
cons: - Onboarding programs are in development

headline: Anonymous Employee
pros:
The atmosphere of the company is very relaxed and laid-back. There are times when it is too laid back, but for the most part the casual vibe of the company is a lot of fun. 

Salesforce has a wonderful culture of giving back time and money to the community. There is no doubt that people abuse this benefit, but for the majority of people who actually use the volunteer time off to volunteer, this benefit can't be beat!

All vending in all offices is free and unlimited. I didn't partake often, but for those days when I really needed something in the mid-afternoon or just had to have something sweet, it was a very awesome perk. The beer tap and winerator were nice perks, too.
cons:
It can be very difficult to get out of a specific role or department if you're not in the HQ offices. 

Promotions and raises are based on favoritism: whoever management likes best gets promoted and gets the biggest raises. If senior management doesn't have first hand knowledge of an employee because the employee is in a different office, it is not at all likely that the employee will be promoted or get a raise. 

Benefits could be better. The free vending is nice and the beer and wine is great, but rather than spending money on all of those perks, better benefits would be appreciated.

headline: #dreamjob
pros:
Takes care of employees
Great benefits
Amazing work culture and people
cons:
Slow at times
Has challenges that any other company this size may face

headline: Salesforce
pros: Awesome vision, spirit, and energy. This company makes you excited to come to work and execute a mission.
cons: Lots of chaos and growing pains

headline: Amazing Company
pros: Smart people, great culture, fun environment
cons: Territory Alignment and constant changing annually

headline: Senior Member Technical Staff
pros: Great benefits, great location, good salary.
cons: Good salary, no lunches, rigid executive hierarchy

headline: Senior Consultant - Technology Architect
pros: Treat employees really well.Compensation is above average.  Felt very appreciated.  Big clients.
cons: So much growth, so fast, which is a great thing but it causes the employees to be spread too thin.

headline: Senior Account Executive
pros: Everyone wants to help you succeed, people do listen to you and there are plenty of resources to get the job done. This is a company that really cares about their customers and will help you succeed while providing the right solution for them.
cons: The job can be addictive, so make sure you find the right balance. No one is pushing you but yourself.

headline: Account Executive
pros: Competitive compensation package and benefits
cons: Growth is challenging patches getting smaller and smaller within Sales Reps

headline: Software Engineer Role
pros: A lot of intelligent people. Great learning experience.
cons: After awhile, work can be not exciting anymore.

headline: Marketing Jobs
pros: Good compensation, leader in the industry, large ecosystem of partners, great stock growth/ESPP/stock options for Director level or higher, good events, good marketing/advertising, time to volunteer (one week a year), unlimited time off for higher level people (but you'll likely be too busy to use it), and growing product portfolio to market.
cons: You could  very likely be overworked and under resourced - employees stretched way too thin. You could have a poor untrained middle manager w/  a VP title and little experience in their area or managing people well. You will likely encounter a growing list of unhappy customers particularly in the small business sector as  the products are too expensive and too hard to use. Managers/exes running scared looking for scapegoats, and you could be one of them.

headline: Great
pros: Great perks, good working environment. Salesforce staff and management (including upper) are friendly. Fairly well run technology.
cons: Talent bar can be a little low. A lot of barriers to productivity, particularly the strength of their QE force.

headline: Best company I've ever worked for
pros:
Salesforce is an amazing company. Built on the foundation & philosophy that “we do well by doing good”.  This is true for how we care for our customers, employees and the communities and world we live in. It’s truly remarkable to see 17,000 people rowing in the same direction. From “Day 1” to today I continue to be impressed.

Growth and innovation run through the DNA of the company. Which gives it the feeling of a 16-year-old start up & creates exciting opportunities for individual career growth. Exciting to work for a company with this type of trajectory. 

Performance of our industry-leading products results in very happy customers. And our customer list represents the world’s greatest brands in every industry vertical.

The culture is unlike any other company I’ve worked for.  As a sales person, it’s great to know we view “sales is a team sport” and “no one wins or loses alone”.  And the teams I get to work with are made up of the top talent in every discipline.

Compensation is great and the benefits are exceptional.
cons:
It's incredibly hard to get hired here & the interview process can be lengthy.

The dynamic nature of the company may be hard for those who don't do well with change.

headline: Fast paced environment
pros:
Competitive Salary
Good People
Downtown Location with access to Bart/Muni
cons: Work Life balance was is a bit tough, very fast paced environment.

headline: 6 month review
pros: Great environment overall.  Both your managers and colleagues are supportive of your success and allowing you to grow within the company.
cons: I think it is common with large companies to have a lot going on (info overload, lots of moving pieces) and it can be a bit overwhelming at times.  Not a deal breaker by any means just on par with what I'd expect similar companies to experience.

headline: Sales Development Manager
pros: Company offers great compensation and growth opportunities. The culture is fantastic have met life long friends here.
cons: Nothing that stands out as bad

headline: good company
pros: good company, nice facilites, nice outlook
cons: could be better company. not anymore

headline: BDR
pros: Great team, interesting work and great pay. Provided you perform, full autonomy over work schedule. Clear career path and exiting/young culture
cons: Suited to competitive hard working people. If you don't  enjoy being compared to colleagues, you will hate the place. Like everywhere, office politics.

headline: SMTS
pros: They value their employees. Great talent to be amongst for contributing and learning. Assessment tests and interviews were right on point for the job. No surprises after starting.
cons: A little too big at times. Challenging to be remote from other team members. Lots of common knowledge about how teams work internally to learn after starting. Can be a lot of noise making it challenging to focus on what is important

headline: Dream Company !!!
pros:
- Fun team and nice people
- Great working culture
- Good Perks
- Excellent community volunteer opportunity
- Good Product
- Amazing cloud computing products
cons:
- Big Company so you need to find your way 
- Big code base and lots of legacy code

headline: Database Engineer
pros: very smart people and decent compensation
cons: long hours and expected to work out of hours.

headline: Fun Large Public Company
pros: Entrepreneurial spirit inside a large public company. Great leadership team with open communication.  Incredible brand. Best place in the world to work to learn the SaaS model.
cons: Can lack the processes required for a company of its size to not feel as though everyone is going in a different directions. Lots of change with the growth (which is also a positive).

headline: Great place to work
pros: I have never worked with a more talented team.  Many companies struggle with phenomenal growth, but the entire SteelBrick team has thrived with our growth.  It is exciting, fast paced and great fun.  2 years here and I can honestly say that I still look forward to work every day.
cons: Already spent too long trying to think of a con.  Nothing comes to mind

headline: Great Environment with Talented People
pros: Great working environment and you can easily contact with different people from different departments. It's a good learning environment as well.
cons: The company is growing very fast.

headline: Salesforce review
pros: Great perks, company outings, great culture
cons: none really, pay is a little less than what other companies pay for support

headline: I got my #Dreamjob
pros: -Awesome Vision, 1/1/1 Community program, Great Benefits and total OTE potential
cons: took almost 4 months to find a position, but it was worth it and I believe it was an atypical situation

headline: Sales: "You are as good as your last month"
pros: Great smart people, good benefits. I loved the excitement that everyone generated about the mission and goals.
cons: Monthly closing of books created an environment of not being able to be more strategic within the group. Lots of politics at the Sr. Sales level and internal channel conflict driven by the compensation structure.

headline: BDR
pros: Great company, growing everyday. A lot of  training, well paid, good career path. Amazing environment, really stimulating and enriching. Going to reach the 20bn of revenue in the coming years
cons: Can be stressful, a lot of competition to get the promotion

headline: The best around
pros: Awesome office, great benefits, leadership position
cons: getting a little big, but that's the price of success.

headline: Great company with a few caveats
pros: Solid benefits, smart people, San Francisco location, product helps millions of people and businesses, company committed to giving back.  Great work-from-home latitude.  So much going on in the company, many opportunities to move around and work with different people on different projects.
cons: A culture of self-promotion and individual success. Not a very team-oriented culture. Fosters focus on building an illusion of personal success internally.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: There is a lot of opportunnity for anyone coming into this organization to move around and build out the necessary skills to grow their career.  If you are looking for opportunities... it exists for the top performers.
cons: This is a big company that you can get lost within unless you make a name for yourself.  Political at times, and hard to navigate to get what you need done, but if you figure it out you can make this a home.

headline: Sales driven culture - Ideal for professional sellers
pros:
If you're fortunate enough to have the opportunity to work at Salesforce in sales you will notice how the company is driven by sales.  Many companies say they are sales driven, but I've never worked anywhere more supportive of the sales engine than Salesforce.com.  The company has the best products I have ever sold and the customers are rapid fans of the company and product.  

If you produce and perform at a high level like I did you will be given opportunities to grow within the company.
cons:
Like all companies which reach this scale, territories are divided up to the point where there's almost no meat on the bones for a salesperson to chew. 

Despite the great sales culture, there's also a culture of cronyism that is not all that welcoming to outsiders.  Advice to new hires is to work overtime to network within the company.  You will need those connections to get noticed across a 10,000 + person company.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: There is a lot of opportunnity for anyone coming into this organization to move around and build out the necessary skills to grow their career.  If you are looking for opportunities... it exists for the top performers.
cons: This is a big company that you can get lost within unless you make a name for yourself.  Political at times, and hard to navigate to get what you need done, but if you figure it out you can make this a home.

pros:
If you're fortunate enough to have the opportunity to work at Salesforce in sales you will notice how the company is driven by sales.  Many companies say they are sales driven, but I've never worked anywhere more supportive of the sales engine than Salesforce.com.  The company has the best products I have ever sold and the customers are rapid fans of the company and product.  

If you produce and perform at a high level like I did you will be given opportunities to grow within the company.
